text: The 27th Legislative Assembly of Ontario was in session from September 25, 1963, until September 5, 1967, just prior to the 1967 general election. The majority party was the Ontario Progressive Conservative Party led by John Robarts. Donald Hugo Morrow served as speaker for the assembly. {| class="wikitable" !Riding !Member !Party !Notes |- |Algoma—Manitoulin |Stanley William Farquhar |Liberal | |- |Armourdale |Gordon Carton |Progressive Conservative | |- |Beaches |Robert John Harris |Progressive Conservative | |- |Bellwoods |John Yaremko |Progressive Conservative | |- |Bracondale |Joseph M.
